message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.DS 

This paper deals with the problem of rendezvous in cognitive radio networks, which involves the use of information theory, networking, distributed computing, and algorithms. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also deals with networking and communication aspects, making cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) another likely sub-category. The problem of rendezvous involves coordination and synchronization, which are key aspects of distributed computing, making cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also deals with the design of deterministic channel hopping schedules, which involves the use of algorithms and optimization techniques, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the design of control systems for cognitive radio networks, which involves the use of control theory and system dynamics, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) a possible sub-category.
